Wizzer Works Home Page : Software Engineering : Toolroot : rpmDiff

rpmDiff.pl -- Perl Script for Comparing RPM Distribution Packages

Author: Mark S. Millard
Last Modified: May 31, 2000

NAME

rpmDiff.pl -- compare a candidate BOM against a master BOM

SYNOPSIS

perl rpmDiff.pl [--verbose] [--mpackage= | --mlist=]master [--cpackage= | --clist=]candidate

DESCRIPTION

rpmDiff.pl compares a candidate bill-of-materials (BOM) against a master bill-of-materials (BOM), reporting what entries are missing from the candidate or are extra in the candidate. Any entries in the master which are not in the candidate are written to a file named "missing". Any entries which are in the candidate and not in the master are written to a file named "extra".

Options

--mpackage=master - master is an uninstalled RPM package with a .rpm extension
--mlist=master - master is a file containing a list of files to compare the candidate against
--cpackage=candidate - candidate is an uninstalled RPM package with a .rpm extension
--clist=candidate - candidate is a list of files to be compared against the master
--verbose - be verbose about the comparison process

--mpackage= and --mlist= are mutually exclusive. Likewise, so are --cpackage= and --clist=. When these options are not applied, the default behavior is to assume that the BOM is an installed RPM package.

DIAGNOSTICS

rpmDiff.pl returns non-zero if there are any problems with the files or any missing or extra entries in candidate.

EXAMPLES

perl rpmDiff.pl wz_toolroot-base-0.5-1 --cpackage=wz_toolroot-base-0.5-1.i386.rpm

This example will compare the installed RPM package wz_toolroot-base-0.5-1 with the uninstalled RPM package file wz_toolroot-0.5-1.i386.rpm. If files exist in the candidate, wz-toolroot-0.5-1.i386.rpm, which are not in the master, wz_toolroot-0.5-1, then a file named extra will be created with the list of the extra files.

perl rpmDiff.pl --mpackage=wz_toolroot-base-0.5-1.i386.rpm --clist=wz_toolroot.BOM
 
This example will compare the uninstalled package file wz_toolroot-0.5-1.i386.rpm with the ASCII file wz_toolroot.BOM. If files existing in the candidate, wz_toolroot.BOM, are missing from the master, wz_toolroot-base-0.5-1.i386.rpm, then a file named missing will be created with the list of missing files.

 

SEE ALSO

InstallBuilder, rpmList
